column4: i try to update my ubuntu by terminal.. i enter 'sudo apt-get update'... what should i do after terminal finish reading package?
i try to update my ubuntu by terminal.. i enter 'sudo apt-get update'... what should i do after terminal finish reading package?
What do you mean "update"?  Just grab newest packages?
I just enter 'sudo apt-get update'
What are you trying to accomplish?
i want to know what should i do after terminal finish read the package...
right, what are you trying to *do*?  just get the newest versions of stuff?
what do u mean? I just want to update via terminal..
update could mean a number of things.  I'm just going to presume to know what you want: sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
thanks.. if i want to upgrade now, but i not shutdown my pc before the download finish... could i continue it later if i online back?
sorry....
if i want to upgrade now, but i shutdown my pc before the download finish... can i continue it later if i online back?
Yeah, but don't stop it once the downloads finish and it starts actually doing the upgrade
What are you trying to install though?
That's in the repositories, yeah.
sudo apt-get install ettercap
i know about apt-get... just i want to install manually...
doing it manually won't give you a whole lot of information, instead of sudo apt-get install ettercap, you just configure, make, make install.  one command vs three, not a whole lot of insight.
i try make form tarball, because, maybe sometime i don;t have connection internet... so i need to install from tarball.
If you don't have an internet connection, you're not going to magically have the source.
i download tarball from somewhre and back to my room then install it..
you can do the same with debs, actually.
Synaptic will even generate a download script for you
